section2.title: 2. Collection and Storage of Personal Data
section2.dataTypesDesc: We collect personal data such as name, email address, phone number, project information, and IP address that you provide to us through contact forms or when logging in to our website.
purposes: for creating and executing project offers
for improving website functionality and user experience
for ensuring login and session management (Cookies)

section3.title: 3. Data Processing and Sharing
section3.thirdPartyDesc: This website uses Google Analytics, a web analytics service provided by Google Ireland Limited. Google Analytics uses cookies to analyze website usage. Information generated by cookies about your use of this website is usually transferred to and stored on a Google server in the USA. The IP address is anonymized ('IP anonymization').
section3.dataSharingDesc: Data collected through Google Analytics may be transmitted to Google. This data is used exclusively for statistical and analytical purposes and is not used to identify individual users.

section4.title: 4. User Rights
rights: obtain information about your stored data according to Art. 15 GDPR
request correction of incorrect or incomplete data according to Art. 16 GDPR
request deletion of your data according to Art. 17 GDPR
request restriction of processing according to Art. 18 GDPR
receive your data in a portable format according to Art. 20 GDPR
object to processing according to Art. 21 GDPR
section4.contact: To exercise these rights, you can contact us anytime at hi@logicloom.de

section5.title: 5. Cookies and Tracking
section5.cookiesDesc: Our website uses cookies to ensure the login process and technical functions. These cookies do not store sensitive personal information and are automatically deleted after logout.
section5.analyticsDesc: Google Analytics is used to analyze and improve our online services. You can prevent cookie storage through your browser settings or revoke your consent at any time via the cookie banner.
section5.settingsDesc: You can change your cookie settings at any time by clicking on the cookie icon at the bottom of the page.

section6.title: 6. Data Security
section6.description: We use technical and organizational measures to protect your personal data from loss, misuse, or unauthorized access. Our security measures are regularly reviewed and adapted according to the state of the art.

section7.title: 7. Legal Basis for Data Processing
section7.intro: The processing of your personal data is based on the following legal grounds according to GDPR:
bases: Art. 6 Para. 1 lit. a GDPR: Consent (e.g., when using the contact form or cookies)
Art. 6 Para. 1 lit. b GDPR: Contract fulfillment or pre-contractual measures
Art. 6 Para. 1 lit. f GDPR: Legitimate interest in improving and securing our website

section9.title: 9. Data Retention and Deletion
section9.description: Personal data is only stored for as long as necessary for the respective purpose or as required by legal retention obligations. After the purpose ceases or the legal deadlines expire, the data will be deleted.

section1.title: 1. Scope of Application
section1.intro: These general terms and conditions apply to all contracts between LogicLoom – Hamidreza Pakzad, Hannover, Germany (hereinafter referred to as "LogicLoom") and the respective client (hereinafter referred to as "Customer").
points: Deviating or conflicting conditions of the customer will not be recognized unless LogicLoom expressly agrees to them in writing.
LogicLoom provides its services exclusively to entrepreneurs within the meaning of § 14 BGB, i.e. within the framework of commercial or independent professional activity.

section2.title: 2. Contract Formation
points: A contract is concluded as soon as the customer accepts an offer from LogicLoom in writing or by email.
Acceptance of a cost estimate or project description also constitutes contract formation.

section3.title: 3. Scope of Services
section3.intro: LogicLoom offers services in the following areas:
details: The exact scope of services is determined by the individual offer or project agreement.
The content (texts, images, logos, etc.) required for project creation is provided by the customer. The customer guarantees that they own all rights to the provided materials.

Upon completion, the customer receives a preview version for review. Change requests within the agreed scope are free of charge; additional adjustments will be charged according to effort. After final acceptance, the project is considered completed.

section4.title: 4. Customer Cooperation Obligations
section4.description: The customer commits to providing all necessary information, files, and approvals in a timely manner. Delays caused by late cooperation do not affect the payment schedule.

section5.title: 5. Payment Terms
section5.intro: Unless otherwise agreed, payment is made in two installments:
section5.cancellation: In case of cancellation by the customer:
cancellationRules: Within 3 days after contract conclusion → full refund.
After 3 days → 50% of the deposit (25% of the total amount) is retained; the rest is refunded.
section5.delay: In case of payment delay, LogicLoom is entitled to suspend further work until outstanding amounts are settled.

section6.title: 6. Copyright and Usage Rights
points: Until full payment, all created designs, codes, and concepts remain the property of LogicLoom.
After full payment, the customer receives an unrestricted, simple usage right.
Transfer, reuse, or sale to third parties requires LogicLoom's consent.
LogicLoom may mention completed projects (e.g., screenshots, links, or logos) as references on its own website or in portfolios, unless the customer expressly objects.

section7.title: 7. Confidentiality and NDA
section7.description: LogicLoom treats all project-related information confidentially. Upon request, a separate NDA (Non-Disclosure Agreement) will be concluded with the customer to ensure the security of ideas and project data.

section8.title: 8. Liability
points: LogicLoom is only liable for intent and gross negligence.
No liability is assumed for indirect damages, lost profits, or data loss, unless there is intent or gross negligence.
The liability amount is limited to the contract value.

section9.title: 9. Data Protection
section9.description: LogicLoom processes personal data exclusively in accordance with the applicable General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Details are described in the privacy policy at https://logicloom.de/privacy

section10.title: 10. Term and Termination
points: The collaboration applies for the project duration agreed in the offer.
After completion, the customer can commission additional or maintenance services separately.
Early termination is possible, but the refund conditions mentioned under point 5 apply.

section11.title: 11. Final Provisions
points: The place of jurisdiction is Hannover.

Should individual provisions of these terms and conditions be or become invalid, the validity of the remaining provisions remains unaffected. The parties commit to replacing the invalid provision with an economically equivalent one.
